info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 19 at 1:45PM CDT until June 20 at 10:36PM CDT by NWS Wichita KS
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kansas...
Ninnescah River near Belle Plaine affecting Sumner County.
Ninnescah River near Peck affecting Sedgwick and Sumner Counties.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Ninnescah River near Belle Plaine.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening.
* IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Three miles west of Belle Plaine near the gage site, a small section of K55 floods east of the bridge. Flood waters flow over Highway 81 starting at 1/2 mile north of K55 and spreading to 100th Avenue. The water on Highway 81 may be near 1.5 ft deep.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 24.2 feet and near its crest. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late tonight and continue falling to near 11.5 feet by Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet.
info.instruction:
Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don't drown.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 145 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING
